TopicTitle: Reapers (aircraft Replica packs) updating to 1.0.5 starting with F16

Articles.Content:
hey guys i'm starting my rebuild of my real live fighter plane's

The results should be:

More accurate replica's.

lesser parts per plane.

(everthing green is up to date)

The american replica's

form left to right:

A10, Harrier, F15E, B2, F16, F18E, F22, F35 and in the middle the SR-71

craft file's:

F16 http://www./download/pdpt368s3bw6prf/1_0_5_F16.craft

The russian replica's

from left to right:

SU27, Mig 21, Foxbat, Sukhoi 47, Mig23, Mig39

europa aircraft pack

video showcasing the planes:

download counter for 0.25: 4016

if you like my craft give me some love and press the rep button on the bottom left

The Harrier, American you say?

Nice replicas btw!

The Harrier, American you say?

Nice replicas btw!

dont the amerian use them to????

Airlines of the Americas use Airbus', but it doesn't make them American! I suppose McDonnell Douglas/Boeing licence built them, adding parts suitable for the USAF rather than the RAF, but still. The RAF used Mustangs with Merlins but I wouldn't call them British.

Airlines of the Americas use Airbus', but it doesn't make them American! I suppose McDonnell Douglas/Boeing licence built them, adding parts suitable for the USAF rather than the RAF, but still. The RAF used Mustangs with Merlins but I wouldn't call them British.

the craftfiles are uploaded now and

Wait, no Foxbat on the Russian side? You'd better be working on it already...

Rune. Come on, first fighter to go over Mach 3... on a >80% steel airframe.

Wait, no Foxbat on the Russian side? You'd better be working on it already...

Rune. Come on, first fighter to go over Mach 3... on a >80% steel airframe.

Ill get on it rune
your order is is ready rune

There, much better. Soviet aeronautical technology is sure weird, but it has its own epic stuff too. Too bad it isn't more well known as the impressive feat it was! Consider this: on a "runaway acceleration" in these things, the engines turned into effective ramjets, and they run unchecked until the engines blew up due to it sucking the compressor blades into the combustion chamber, or else when they run out of fuel after pushing the 30mT beast up to Mach 3.2 (clocked over Syria on a recon plane, leaving behind the SAMs launched after it). That was why they were operationally limited to Mach 2.83, the plane landed on melted engines if it went over.

Rune. The Foxbat is one of the craziest things that ever flew successfully.

Edited November 3, 2014 by Rune

You know what I want?

A Foxbat with intake precoolers like the SABRE engines.

Speaking of which, I wonder what the MiG-31 is capable of in terms of top speed?
